intro: Lissanthe montana, commonly known as the mountain lissanthe, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are accompanied by finely divided, aromatic leaves. Lissanthe montana is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
